title: There goes Riot again with their misleading Champion design
body:
#This
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/1/1b/Pyke_OriginalSkin.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180522202426
#has nothing to do with this
https://canalrivertrust.org.uk/refresh/media/original/21055.jpg?v=92e60b
#or these
http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y158/Exequy/18944691.jpg

##Rito, I expected a medieval infantry formation consisting entirely of fish and all I got was a ghost that loves taking my ADCs kills. This is stupid. Please fix.

replies.body:
https://imgur.com/p9I94PD

But he is exactly like this

The guy swims like a fish and summons his big bro during ulti, though.

At least the ludo-narrative dissonance will never be as bad as Thresh's, who is an evil spirit hell bent and take pride in being evil and killing others to torture their souls forever and is somehow a support champ in the game. At least Pyke gives their allies a "cut" to signify the relationship with his teammates, Thresh is kinda just there doing benevolent act when he is a sadistic psychotic loner in the lore.

{{champion:412}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3094}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3036}} + dark harvest

... wait no he straight up murders them like this. shit.

First kudos to you for saying ludo-narrative dissonance. 

Second stormrazor Thresh offers a ridiculous amount of consistent frontloaded damage. Then you get to watch as they limp around lane while you walk in and out of AA range. That's torture.

Hey, if you've ever seen the rage of Lee Sin who gets denied his sweet insec kick by a well timed flay, or take the Vi ulting your adc under tower with a nice lantern before holding her down with your hook so said adc can get their revenge, then you know that there's plenty of suffering to cause as Support Thresh.

Okay think about this. Thresh is one of the most evil beings in the game who loves to torture people... being a support makes TOTAL sense.

It's not that he DOESN'T do damage, he doesn't WANT to do damage and hes tanky because hes already strong XD

> [{quoted}](name=SEKAI,realm=OCE,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=QOwITeO1,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-08-09T08:12:38.814+0000)
>
> The guy swims like a fish and summons his big bro during ulti, though.
> 
> At least the ludo-narrative dissonance will never be as bad as Thresh's, who is an evil spirit hell bent and take pride in being evil and killing others to torture their souls forever and is somehow a support champ in the game. At least Pyke gives their allies a "cut" to signify the relationship with his teammates, Thresh is kinda just there doing benevolent act when he is a sadistic psychotic loner in the lore.

Thresh top says hello.

yep, though it's one of his more difficult positions to pull off and requires a lot of knowledge of the opposing champions

at best he'll go even with most of the roster because his top build is heavily item dependent

at worst, he has very low armor and most of his opponents will be doing physical damage
He's literally just a drowned corpse for a champion.
Damn i should jump off a bridge to become as badass as Pyke
Take your upvote and go away you hilarious bastard

I've added {{champion:555}} to my list of reasons to quit.

Sometimes I fantasize about a League of Legends II that has less than 100 champions, abilities that can be understood without a PhD, and that doesn't undergo massive visual or mechanical reworks every five minutes.

And, you know, lore that makes sense (even though I never read it).
Riot "Bro Cult" Game felt that one champ with a y replacing an i in a regular word wasn't enough. Enter Pyke.
